title: Imp

adjectives: Irritated, in a temper, feeling or displaying anger.
Extremely violent, severe, ferocious or savage.
Marked by extreme and violent energy
Marked by extreme and violent energy.
verbs: To disturb with fear; to throw into a state of alarm or fright; to affright; to terrify.
To become enraged, angry, or irritated.
To madden, to anger, to frustrate.
To look angry or sullen, wrinkle one's forehead, as if to signal disapproval.
Look angry or sullen, wrinkle one's forehead, as if to signal disapproval
nouns: Part of the body at the front of the head
The face is a central organ of sense and is also very central in the expression of emotion among humans and among numerous other species.
Faces are the central sense organ complexes, for those animals that have one, normally on the ventral surface of the head.
The front of the human head from the forehead to the chin and ear to ear
The front part of the head, featuring the eyes, nose, and mouth and the surrounding area.
A story about fairies; told to amuse children
Fairy tales are a type of story which typically features fantasy characters, such as fairies, goblins, elves, trolls, dwarves, giants, mermaids, or gnomes, and usually magic or enchantments. tale

A fairy tale is a type of short story that typically features European folkloric fantasy characters, such as dwarves, elves, fairies, giants, gnomes, goblins, mermaids, trolls, or witches, and usually magic or enchantments.
A folktale featuring fairies or similar fantasy characters.
A fictional story that usually features folkloric characters (such as fairies, goblins, elves, trolls, witches, giants, and talking animals) and enchantments
Fictional story featuring folkloric fantasy characters
Basic emotion
Anger is an emotional response related to one's psychological interpretation of having been threatened.
The state of being angry
The state of being angry.
Anger is a common emotional response to real or imagined threats or harm to oneself or others, characterized by a desire, whether internalized or expressed, to engage in aggressive retaliation.
The literary genre generally dealing with themes of magic and fictive medieval technology.
Fantasy refers to constructs of the imagination; in storytelling Fantasy generally refers to a genre that uses magic and other supernatural forms as a primary element of plot, theme, and/or setting.
Fantasy is a genre of fiction that commonly uses magic and other supernatural phenomena as a primary plot element, theme, or setting.
A genre of literature and art that uses magic and other supernatural forms as a primary element of plot and theme. The storyline is often set in a fictional, historically oriented setting.
Genre of fiction
A monstrous thing, person or act.
Someone or something that is markedly unusual.
A horribly deformed person.
A person or animal that is markedly unusual or deformed
In current usage, the word "freak" is commonly used to refer to a person with something strikingly unusual about their appearance or behavior.
Person or thing that is monstrous.
Monstrous thing, person or act.
Unusual person
The words "dÃ¦mon" and "daim?n" are Latinized versions of the Greek" ??????", a reference to the daemons of ancient Greek religion and mythology, as well as later Hellenistic religion and philosophy.
A demon, daemon or fiend, is a supernatural, often malevolent being prevalent in religion, occultism, literature, fiction, mythology and folklore.
A good or benevolent nature spirit in classical Greek mythology
Paranormal, often malevolent being prevalent in religion, occultism, literature, fiction, and folklore
An evil supernatural being
An evil spirit.
A diabolically evil person
Title given to the supernatural being, who is believed to be a powerful, evil entity and the tempter of humankind.
The Devil is believed in many religions, myths and cultures to be a supernatural entity that is the personification of evil and the enemy of God and humankind.
Satan is a term, as well as the name of a figure appearing in the texts of the Abrahamic religions who brings evil and temptation, and is known as the deceiver that leads humanity astray.
The great red dragon, as referenced from Revelation 12:3
Believed in many religions, myths and cultures to be a supernatural entity that is the personification of evil and the enemy of God and humankind
The Devil is the name given to a supernatural entity, who, in many Western religions, is the primary embodiment of evil.
A chief or reigning devil.
(Judeo-Christian and Islamic religions) chief spirit of evil and adversary of God; tempter of mankind; master of Hell
Christian devil
In Christian Science, an evil or erring entity.
An evil or erring entity.
Beelzebub or Beel-Zebub is a contemporary name for the devil.

A satanic being

description:
A face, usually purple, with two devil horns, frowning mouth and eyes, and eyebrows scrunched downwards in anger. Bears the same expression as ðŸ˜  Angry Face and ðŸ˜¡ Pouting Face on most platforms. Google’s design is red and Facebook’s has black horns, green eyes, and clenched teeth.

Its Unicode name, Imp, alludes to a small demon in folklore, though the smiley is commonly used to represent devils and devilish behavior, especially around Halloween. It is also used to convey various sentiments of anger or ideas of evil. More menacing than its counterpart, ðŸ˜ˆ Smiling Face With Horns.

Samsung previously depicted a childlike character with red hair and horns, fangs, and black wings. Earlier designs from Google featured an orangish-red character with blue hair and wings.
apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the angry face with horns emoji is a vibrant, fiery red, radiating a palpable sense of fury. Its devilish horns curve sharply upwards, and its furrowed brow and sharp, bared teeth convey intense frustration or mischievous anger, all rendered with Apple's signature glossy 3D shading and realistic lighting. This emoji, as seen on your iPhone or Mac, is perfect for expressing a playful yet strong feeling of being thoroughly annoyed or a bit devilish in your digital conversations.
